title: Employment Specialist
company: Mary Pomerantz Advertising for Catholic Charities of Brooklyn & Queens
description:
For over 125 years, Catholic Charities Brooklyn and Queens has been providing quality social services to the neighborhoods of Brooklyn and Queens, and currently offers 160-plus programs and services for children, youth, adults, seniors, and those struggling with mental illness.

The ACT team provides an integrated set of evidence-based treatment, rehabilitation, case management, and support services delivered by a mobile, multi-disciplinary mental health treatment team. ACT supports client recovery through a highly individualized approach that provides clients with the tools to obtain and maintain housing, employment, relationships and relief from symptoms and medication side effects. ACT services are developed through the person-centered service planning process and adjusted through the process of daily team meetings.

STATEMENT OF THE JOB:

As a member of the CCNS ACT Team, the Employment Specialist will provide intensive in-home and community-based services to individuals living with severe mental illness, who have a treatment history characterized by frequent use of psychiatric hospitalization and emergency rooms, involvement with the criminal justice system, alcohol/substance abuse, and lack of engagement in traditional outpatient services. Under the supervision of the Clinical Director, the Employment Specialist will utilize a person-centered planning process to provide rehabilitation, case management and support services to individuals served by the ACT Team. The Employment Specialist will lead the team in integrating vocational goals and services with the tasks of all team members to support individual participation in vocational training, adult education, ESL, and competitive employment. This person will have experience in vocational assessment, job exploration and skills development in obtaining and maintaining employment. The Employment Specialist will conduct assertive outreach and engagement, utilize motivational interviewing and Individual Placement and Support (IPS) to support vocational and educational goals when working with individuals served by the ACT team.

\\* Responsible for providing services to clients in their home environment, community settings, provider offices and additional locations as needed.

\\* Responsible for providing direct support services to clients with psychiatric diagnoses, co-occurring substance use, chronic physical health problems and complex social needs.

\\* Assess and provide direct services to participants in the following areas: health and wellness, housing, income support, education, vocational training, employment and social supports, medication support.

\\* Provide individual employment and vocational counseling. Provide assistance through all phases of the vocational service.

\\* Identify services individuals should receive based on assessment of education, vocational and work history, and a person’s immediate needs; recommend treatment objectives for an individual’s service plan.

\\* Assist with creation of resumes and CVs; assists with completion of applications, interview preparation.

\\* Refer individuals to employment programs and assist with job development activities.

\\* Participate in daily treatment review meetings, leading the discussions around vocational/educational issues and incorporating findings into service plans.

\\* Assist individuals with symptom management skills; identify and clarify rehabilitation and recovery goals.

\\* Develop crisis intervention and relapse prevention plans.

\\* Coordinate care and develop comprehensive service plans and 6-month service plan reviews in collaboration with individuals, families and natural supports, housing, providers, hospitals, shelter staff, criminal justice personnel, Assisted Outpatient Treatment (AOT), and any additional community partners to promote attainment of treatment and recovery goals.

\\* Use motivational interviewing, recovery and trauma-informed approaches when delivering services.

\\* Meet monthly required levels of treatment contacts with at least 80% of contacts occurring in the community.

\\* Meet required service intensity and frequency to support monthly billing.

\\* Complete and signs progress notes, assessments, care plans, incident reports, and other required documentation in accordance to the New York State Office of Mental Health (OMH) regulations, the New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene (DOHMH) guidelines, and Medicaid billing standards and regulations

\\* Provide 24/7 on-call crisis intervention on-call services on rotating basis.

\\* Represent the agency at internal and external provider meetings.

title: Wireless NOC Analyst
description:
**Additional Information**

* Location: Miami, FL, Rochester or Melville, NY (no preference)
* 12-month assignment with opportunity to extend or convert.
* M-F, 8hr. days, 40 hr. work weeks, OT is approved.
* Schedule: This will be a hybrid role with 2 days in the office and 2 days are WFH, however training/onboarding will be in the office to start with 100% (2-3 months if needed).
* This will be 4 (10-hour shifts) per week. Saturday, Sunday, Monday and Tuesday are workdays.
* The client is flexible on 1 of 2 shift times. 9PM to 7AM OR 10PM to 8AM.
* Top Skills: Telecom NOC environment experience, ticketing experience, Sienna 6500 or 3500, MRV, Juniper routers, Cisco routers, SONET. IBM Netcool is a plus.

Seeking a Network Operations Center Network Analyst. Within this role the Analyst will oversee the configuration, layout, maintenance of the entire network. This person will also analyze, supply feedback, look for trends and provide additional technical support to the Network Control Center. The Analyst will also research and evaluate the network through our NMS tool and recommend needs where applicable. This role will also include interaction with our customer base to provide support, status and direction to ongoing initiatives. The Analyst will need to be well versed with the administration of a heterogeneous network across multiple platforms. The Analyst will work cross-functionally with internal departments, external vendors and the NOC team to coordinate corrective actions, resolve issues, provide documentation as well as metric to performance within our deployed infrastructure.

**Responsibilities:**

* Plan, validate and deploy network corrective measures as needed
* Provide network troubleshooting documentation and run books for the department
* Continuously review all NMS and EMS systems for process improvement
* Interface directly with customers related to identified chronic issues till resolution
* Investigate and supply TRR’s to customers as requested
* Work with support and vendors to resolve complex network problems
* Organize and drive all post mortem meetings till resolution and closure
* Provide weekly ticket review related to all NOC tickets to ensure accuracy and content
* Provide the deep dive analysis through the NMS system to proactively identify network issues
* Provide metrics (internal and/or customer facing) to management as requested related to team and network performance
* Lead all complex change management activity
* Provide feedback to management on process and procedural improvement
* Direct compilation and validation of records and reports concerning network operation and maintenance
* Effectively prioritize workload and alter as needed in the interest of the business needs
* Lead by example and drive the core values of the company
* Always ensure a quality customer experience

**Qualifications:**

* 5+ years’ network administration experience with a NOC environment, include monitoring and surveillance
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, interpersonal and presentation skills
* Ability to manage complex issues and drive action items with customers and inter-departments
* Ability to promote cross-functional collaboration and teamwork.
* Ability to perform tasks with minimal supervision
* Certifications in leading networking hardware/software is a plus
* Experience with IBM Netcool is a plus

**Education:**

* Bachelor's degree from an accredited College or University in computer science or related area required.
* Equivalent work experience in a similar position may be substituted for educational requirements.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $50.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Night shift

Experience:

* NOC Surveillance: 5 years (Required)
* Juniper: 5 years (Required)
* Network administration: 5 years (Required)
* Network monitoring: 5 years (Required)
* IBM Netcool: 5 years (Required)
* networking hardware/software: 5 years (Preferred)
* Telecom NOC environment: 5 years (Required)
* ticketing: 5 years (Preferred)
* Sienna 6500 or 3500: 5 years (Required)
* MRV: 5 years (Required)
* Juniper routers: 5 years (Required)
* Cisco routers: 5 years (Required)
* SONET: 5 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

title: VP, School Programs Implementation
description:
The Jed Foundation (JED) is a nonprofit organization that protects emotional health and prevents suicide for our nation’s teens and young adults. The Academic Programs division, under the leadership of the Senior Vice President of Academic Programs, represents JED’s largest team and encompasses all schools-based programmatic work for the organization across PK-12 and Higher Education, nationwide, as well as the onboarding and operational functions for those programs. This team supports academic institutions as they create an interdisciplinary task force, complete organizational and student-facing assessments of policies, programs, and practices, and then create feedback reports and strategic plans for each institution. The JED team then provides ongoing customized support and technical assistance as the school implements its comprehensive school mental health plan.  

We are seeking a dedicated and dynamic professional to fill the role of Vice President of School Program Implementation. Reporting directly to the Senior Vice President (SVP), Academic Programs, this position is critical in supporting the successful implementation and day to day operations of our high school, boarding school, district, and higher education programs, and their leaders and staff. The Vice President of Program Implementation will play a key role in ensuring that our comprehensive approach to mental health and suicide prevention is executed effectively across educational institutions.  

Additionally, the VP, Program Implementation, will serve as an important senior leader within the Academic Programs Division, working very closely as a trusted thought partner and colleague to the Senior Vice President in setting and executing the overall vision and strategy for the division as a whole.  

**This is a national, remote position (New York/Tri-State Area Preferred)**. This role should reside within an easy (approx. 60 min) commuting distance from an airport to facilitate transit to various schools/districts/institutions nationwide and must have the ability and desire to travel to conferences, internal meetings, and to the JED headquarters office in NYC regularly (up to 25% travel).
Key Responsibilities


**Program Execution**
* Collaborate closely with the SVP to oversee day-to-day field operations of Academic Programs and the development, planning, and execution of strategies to implement our Comprehensive Approach in high schools, boarding schools, districts and higher education institutions.
* In close partnership with Academic Programs department heads, oversee and coordinate the day-to-day operations of program implementation at the regional and school levels, quality assurance, and customer/partner experience.
* Ensure that programs maintain fidelity to our Comprehensive Approach while adapting to the unique needs of each institution.
* Bridge program fidelity, implementation, and growth with a deep appreciation and understanding of all, leveraging JED assets to ensure success in each area.

  

  

**Stakeholder Collaboration**
* Collaborate with regional teams, internal and external Subject Matter Experts, and partners to ensure a coordinated and effective approach to program implementation.
* Establish and maintain relationships with K-12 and higher education leaders to facilitate successful school recruitment and ongoing engagement and retention.

  

  

**Data and Impact**
* Support the SVP, Design and Impact, in developing clear data collection tools, and then collecting and analyzing data to evaluate program effectiveness, and serving as primary lead on program updates and design processes on behalf of Academic Programs in alignment with the SVP, Academic Programs.
* Assist in making data-driven decisions and implementing improvements as needed to achieve desired outcomes.

  

  

**Training and Development**
* Develop and deliver both onboarding and training programs for Academic Programs staff and regional implementation teams.
* Promote professional development and growth among implementation staff to enhance program performance, with a special focus on school mental health and suicide prevention content, as well as consulting acumen.

  

  

**Operational Oversight**
* Collaborate with the SVP of Academic Programs, the CFO, and Chief Development Officer to ensure that program operations align with budgetary constraints and grant requirements and deliverables.
* Work with the SVP and Director, Program Operations, and other division-leadership to streamline and optimize division-wide program operations, workflows, and other processes and procedures that support organizational needs.
Skills, Knowledge & Expertise


* A seasoned and experienced leader of people and programs, with a minimum of 10 years progressive leadership experience and a track record of success in executing complex projects and/or programs, strongly preferred.
* Minimum of master’s level training in education, educational leadership, counseling, psychology, social work, or related field preferred; LPC, MSW, MPH, MED, and established EdD, or PhD degree-holders are encouraged to apply.
* Strong technical knowledge of what it takes to build and manage programs, specifically the implementation of technical assistance programs and/or consulting services, required.
* Expertise, or the willingness to acquire expertise, in suicide prevention and mental health, especially as it pertains to work in secondary and K-12 education settings, relationships with partners and peer organizations, and JED’s ability to access government funding for schools-based work. Past experience working with schools/universities and/or in the mental health space is a plus, but not required.

  

  

**Additional Qualifications:**
* Excellent verbal communication.
* Excellent written communication with experience in drafting report-style formats, with attention to detail.
* Excellent presentation skills with experience and comfort presenting to large groups, including senior leadership both internally and externally.
* Strong interpersonal and relationship management skills, including comfort with establishing new partnerships, identifying new business opportunities, and a history of maintaining high partner engagement.
* Experience working with Salesforce or other CRM systems strongly preferred.
* Ability to travel to high school campuses, conferences, and other JED engagements throughout the Intermountain State Region, as well as JED headquarters in NYC regularly (30% travel).
* Strong interpersonal and leadership skills, capable of collaborating with diverse teams and working in partnership with others.
* Goal oriented, with a record of inspiring cross-functional teams to meet and exceed expectations.
* A leader with a record of implementing and scaling a national program.
* Experience leading regional teams and understanding the dynamic of regional teams and a national headquarters environment.
* A record of championing change and an ability to lead with authenticity and accountability.
* Proven ability to inspire trust with individuals from a wide variety of backgrounds and experiences and lead and facilitate with strong interpersonal skills and move from ideas to action.
* An inspiring communicator who can articulate vision and direction to a wide audience as well as being effective one-on-one.
* Track record of success leading a large department or organization through change.
* Self-driven and results-oriented with a positive outlook and strong problem-solving skills.
* Strong research, analytical, and critical thinking abilities, and the ability to analyze and apply data to draw meaningful conclusions.
* Experience in research and evaluation methodology, strongly preferred.
Pay Ranges / Location / Travel Information


**Pay Ranges:**  

The range listed on this job posting is based on JED's compensation posting ranges. Salaries may be higher or lower depending on experience and geographic location. Additionally, you will be eligible to participate in our company’s equity program, plus our robust medical, dental, vision, retirement, mental health, and other benefits offered to permanent benefit eligible employees.  

  

**Location/Travel Information:**  

Please note that this position is largely remote and is based out of the NY/Tri-State Area but will require retreat/business meetings at JED’s central office in NYC or other locations as designated by JED leadership. Additional travel may be required. JED does not reimburse for relocations at this time.  

  

**To Apply:**
If you are a results-oriented professional with a passion for driving impactful change in the field of mental health and suicide prevention, we encourage you to apply for the position of Vice President of Program Implementation. Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your qualifications and dedication to our mission.  

By joining our team, you will play a vital role in ensuring that our comprehensive approach reaches and positively impacts students across the nation. We look forward to receiving your application and learning how you can contribute to our mission.
About The Jed Foundation


JED is a nonprofit that protects emotional health and prevents suicide for our nation’s teens and young adults. We’re partnering with high schools and colleges to strengthen their mental health, substance misuse and suicide prevention programs and systems. We’re equipping teens and young adults with the skills and knowledge to help themselves and each other. We’re encouraging community awareness, understanding and action for young adult mental health.
  
**Application Deadline**


October 07, 2024


**Department**


Programs - Academic


**Employment Type**


Full Time


**Location**


NYC Tri-State Area


**Workplace type**


Hybrid


**Compensation**


$140,000 - $178,000 / year


**Reporting To**


Senior VP, Academic Programs

title: Paraeducator - Special Education - Group 1 Bus (2024-2025 SY)
description:
JobID: 9294  

**Position Type:**  

 Paraprofessional/Paraeducator  

**Date Posted:**  

 9/12/2024  

**Location:**  

 NECC: Norwalk Early Childhood Center  

**Date Available:**  

 September/2024  

**2024-2025 SCHOOL YEAR**  

**SPECIAL EDUCATION PARAEDUCATOR (GROUP 1-BUS)**  

**NORWALK EARLY CHILDHOOD CENTER**
  

**POSITION DESCRIPTION**  

  

Under the direct supervision of a special education teacher, the paraeducator supports students to participate in their educational program and rides a bus route.  

  

**Essential Functions**  

  

**All Paraeducators**
+ Assist in the implementation of the Norwalk Board of Education and administrative policies, rules, regulations and directives
+ Follow Norwalk school policy to ensure student safety
+ Follow teacher’s oral or written directions with accuracy
+ Assist the teacher with the implementation of classroom instructional goals and Section 504 plans
+ Assist students with classwork individually or in small groups
+ Assist the teacher in maintaining student records of attendance
+ Assist the teacher with documentation of student progress
+ Assist the teacher with the preparation and distribution of lesson plan materials
+ Encourage students to interact appropriately with peers
+ Assist students during recess, breaks, emergency drills, assemblies, on school buses and field trips
+ Assist and support students to use computers, iPads or other media to access curriculum
+ Maintain respect at all times for confidential information


  

**Special Education Paraeducators**
+ Perform all responsibilities listed above for all paraeducators **and**
+ Follow teacher’s oral or written directions to assist in the implementation of Individualized Education Plan (IEP) goals
+ Assist the teacher with the implementation of a toilet schedule and program, and/or feeding program
+ Provide escort and mobility assistance to students
+ Assist and support students during community-based activities including, but not limited to job coach activities
+ Assist and support students to develop independent living skills including hygiene, transportation, self-management, food preparation and/or feeding
+ Implement behavioral programs developed by teacher
+ Data collection of student learning activity as developed by the teacher
+ Provide teacher information for progress monitoring and/or daily reports for the teacher to share with parents


  

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**
+ Ability to communicate ideas and directives clearly and effectively, both orally and in writing.
+ Effective, active listening skills
+ Ability to record data with accuracy
+ Ability to work effectively with others
+ Ability to implement teacher directives related to instructional and behavioral goals effectively
+ Organizational and problem-solving skills


  

**Other Duties and Responsibilities**
+ Interact in a positive manner with staff, students, parents, and visitors
+ Promote good public relations by personal appearance, attitude, and conversation
+ Maintain a level of approachability by administration, staff, parents, and visitors
+ Respond to questions and requests in a timely and appropriate manner
+ Attend meetings and professional development activities as recommended by teacher, supervisor, Principal or ELL Instructional Specialist
+ Perform other related duties as assigned by teacher, Principal, Special Education Supervisor or ELL Instructional Specialist
+ Must ride the bus with students.


  

**Qualifications/Certificates**
+ High School diploma or equivalency
+ Bachelor’s Degree, Preferred
+ Associate’s Degree in education or related field or ParaPro Certificate or two (2) years of college required
+ Two (2) years of experience working with children or young adults in a school setting, preferred
+ For Special Education Paraeducators—specific experience working with students with high management needs is preferred
+ May require fluency in Spanish
+ Such alternatives to the above qualifications as the Superintendent and/or Norwalk Board of Education may find appropriate


  

Days: Monday – Friday (37.5 hours weekly/schedule determined by Principal)  

Salary: In accordance with the collective bargaining agreement  

Group: One-Bus  

Bargaining Unit: NFEP  

Work year: August - June (10 Months/40 weeks)  

Benefits: Limited Available

**Click “Employment”**

title: Prevention Navigator/Health Education Specialist
company: AIDS Center of Queens County, Inc
description:
At the AIDS Center of Queens County (ACQC), our mission is to prevent HIV and STIs and promote health and wellness in the communities we serve. This is accomplished by providing health education and intervention services using a harm reduction approach and evidence-based practices in a friendly, respectful, and culturally sensitive environment. Additionally, our role is to conduct substance misuse education workshops, HIV and Hepatitis C testing, and LGBTQ sensitivity trainings for providers. Outreach to community settings is sought to reach the general Queens community and specific sub-populations such as substance users, individuals living with HIV, homeless LBGTQ youth and low-income communities of color. ACQC is seeking a Prevention Navigator/Health Education Specialist for the SAMSHA program in working toward these goals.

**Responsibilities for Prevention Navigator/Health Education Specialist:**

* Develop and maintain partnerships with community-based organizations serving the target population(s): Substance users, HIV-positive clients, at risk individuals, etc.
* Outreach & Recruitment – Create and promote marketing messages and awareness campaigns through social media on the risk of substance misuse amongst the target population and conducting live sessions about topics related to sexual health education.
* Preparing and scheduling updates, sharing relevant content, keeping in touch with followers, encouraging conversation, and answering to client inquiries.
* Assist with health education and risk reduction support groups by assuring availability of all learning materials and supplies needed
* Delivery of CTR – HIV/STI/HepC Testing intervention.
* Conduct an on-going needs assessment including a review of characteristics, statistics, and data to develop and design educational risk reduction material that is specific, sensitive, and culturally relevant to the target population through social media platforms (during COVID-19).
* Conduct group interventions to target population in Queens.
* Provides Linkage to Care services.
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date client/peer chart recordings for program activities and CTR interventions.
* Submit weekly program progress reporting and monthly narrative of program activities.
* Follow COVID guidelines to keep staff and clients safe while in the office.

**Minimum Qualifications for Prevention Navigator/Health Education Specialist:**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Health or related field and 1-year experience; or 2 -4 years related field experience
* Knowledge of HIV/AIDS and substance misuse
* Fluent in one or more targeted community languages
* Sensitive to ethnic and sexual minorities

The Prevention Navigator/Health Education Specialist position is a full-time, non-exempt position, based in Woodside, Queens near the LIRR and #7 trains.

The ideal candidate for the Prevention Navigator/Health Education Specialist position must be hardworking and passionate about public health and education. ACQC offers rewarding work in a collegial environment and comprehensive benefits (medical, dental, vision, pension, paid time off, and commuter benefits).

ACQC provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Please forward cover letter and resume to the attention of the Education & Prevention Manager.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $40,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Weekends as needed

Education:

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

* Community Health & Wellness Occupations: 1 year (Required)

Language:

* Spanish (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Behavioral Health Technician
description:
Sunrise Detox:  

Position Title: Behavioral Health Technician  

  

Sunrise Detox is a premiere center for drug and alcohol detox. Sunrise promises to give you one of the most comfortable medical detox processes available. We believe in creating a different experience where our road to recovery is dignified. Our clients reside in comfortable modern, elegantly furnished rooms where good nutrition is also an essential part of the detoxification process. We offer individual and group counseling to clients and bring in 12 Step meetings to show clients they are not alone once they leave treatment.  

  

Behavioral Health Technician Job description:  

The Behavioral Health Technician is an integral member of the team with extensive patient contact. They provide communication between the patients, medical staff and clinicians. Excellent patient care includes preparation of charts for case management, assisting the medical staff with vitals and ensuring patient needs are met in a timely and proficient manner.  

  

Behavioral Health Technician Duties/Responsibilities:  

* Completion of intakes on new patient admissions, orientation procedures and schedules
* Document attendance for all groups
* Recording inventory log of patient’s personal belongings and valuables
* Interact appropriately with patients and staff, using deescalating skills when necessary

  

Behavioral Health Technician Requirements:  

* High School Diploma or GED
* Knowledge of addiction and mental health a plus
* Experience with Microsoft office products

  

Behavioral Health Technician Schedule:  

* Days, 7:00am-7:30pm
* 12-hour shifts, 3 days a week
* Must be open to one weekend shift per week OR rotating weekends

  

Behavioral Health Technician Compensation:  

* Hourly rate competitive with experience and location
* Night and weekend differential when applicable

  

Full time employees may be eligible for the following:  

* Insurance: Medical, Dental, Vision, and STD options
* Medical FSA and Dependent Care Account
* 401k with company match up to 5%
* Accrued Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Education reimbursement
* Career Advancement Opportunities

  

\\*\\*\\* This job does NOT sponsor visa's and we are unable to consider out of country applicants \\*\\*\\*  

  

If you are interested in this opportunity or know someone that you respect who would be a good fit for this position, please email:  

Clay - Clay@praesumhealthcare.com - Executive Recruiter
  

James - James@praesumhealthcare.com - Executive Recruiter

title: Procurement Specialist/Manager
description:
**The Company:**

Orsman Design [ODI] is an award-winning design firm for interior and landscape lighting. With offices in Southampton, Manhattan, and Miami, ODI serves clients throughout the United States and internationally.

**Role:**

Be part of the Procurement team responsible for managing and directing the purchasing of light fixtures required for various design projects. Develop sound, cost-effective strategies for the sourcing of lighting products and suppliers and the purchasing of products and services for ODI. Create a buying strategy to get the best products at the best price from the best vendor.

**Role and Responsibilities:**

* Find and maintain relationships with suppliers, manufacturers and distributors while continually scouting for additional vendors
* Evaluate budgets while seeking ways to improve and enhance the quality of products purchased and the timeliness of deliveries
* Maintain the vendor database and set up local vendors as needed
* Obtain price quotes for goods and process formal proposals
* Create Credit Memos
* Update new prices in the system, on purchase orders (PO’s) and add any pertinent information
* Generate PO’s using QuickBooks. Verify quoted prices when generating a PO for any item including reordering
* Expedite orders, manage status of purchasing needs for stock items and exterior material
* Review product specifications to maintain a working knowledge of goods or services to be purchased
* Resolve vendor or contractor grievances and claims against suppliers
* Process sample requests and PO’s for the company’s sample library and design mockups
* Attend appropriate lighting events to stay current on new products, new vendors and new suppliers
* Establish strong working relationships with internal design team and keep them apprised of changes to items purchased
* Participate in special projects as directed, to include process improvement with the team
* Provide training to new hires as required
* Other responsibilities as assigned

**Qualifications and Education Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree
* Minimum 2-3 years of experience in procurement or purchasing required
* Also willing to consider someone with 1 year of experience BUT must possess the skills listed below
* Experience in the lighting design industry a plus

**Required Skills:**

* 1 plus years QuickBooks (preferred)
* Must be skilled with Microsoft Office, Excel, Adobe Acrobat, and Outlook
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills needed to effectively partner with all design team members and to negotiate with external vendors
* Strong math/analytical skills required to calculate and process purchase orders
* Highly organized and detailed-oriented
* Ability to handle multiple procurement requests and execute from beginning to end
* Ability to manage a heavy workload within tight time frames
* Solid judgement required to make the right business decisions
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills needed to effectively partner with all design team members
* Demonstrate flexibility to accommodate rapidly changing needs of a growing organization

**Work Location:**

* New York City
* Hybrid role but mostly in office

**Additional Information:**

* Role provides a broad salary range to consider individuals with various levels of experience and skill sets. Final compensation will be determined based on an individual’s specific qualifications and commensurate with experience.

**Resumes can be sent to Careers@orsmandesign.com**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $55,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Customs Broker- Footwear
description:
**Customs Manager- Footwear** 

**Responsibilities:**

* **Identify HTS Codes:**
* Use advanced analytical tools and databases to ensure accurate HTS classification within the footwear industry.
* Engage in continuous training to stay updated with changes in the General Rules of Interpretation.
* **Maintain Compliance:**
* Develop and implement compliance strategies to ensure adherence to CBP and other government regulations.
* Collaborate with legal teams to address compliance issues proactively.
* **Update Classification Database:**
* Regularly audit the Harmonized Classification Database to ensure data integrity.
* Implement automation for database updates to reduce manual errors.
* **Properly Classify Products:**
* Conduct detailed analysis of product specifications, IFI, and physical samples to determine correct HTS codes.
* Engage with product development teams to understand new product lines and their classification requirements.
* **Ensure Compliance with U.S. Import Regulations:**
* Lead compliance training sessions for internal teams to ensure everyone is aware of import regulations.
* Develop comprehensive checklists and guidelines for import compliance.
* **Follow Internal Controls:**
* Implement a robust internal audit process to regularly review compliance with import/export regulations.
* Develop key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of internal controls.
* **Perform Periodic Audits:**
* Use advanced data analytics to identify trends and potential areas of non-compliance in import/export transactions.
* Report audit findings to senior management with recommendations for corrective actions.

**Additional Responsibilities:**

* **Vendor and Supplier Management:**
* Work closely with vendors and suppliers to ensure they comply with all U.S. import regulations.
* Conduct periodic assessments of vendor compliance practices.
* **Documentation Management:**
* Oversee the preparation and submission of all required documentation for import/export activities.
* Ensure accurate record-keeping and archiving of all compliance-related documents.
* **Risk Management:**
* Develop and implement risk management strategies to mitigate potential compliance risks.
* Conduct regular risk assessments and update risk management plans accordingly.

**Additional Required Experience:**

* **Advanced Analytical Skills:**
* Proficiency in using data analytics tools to analyze and interpret complex data sets related to import/export activities.
* Experience with predictive analytics for compliance forecasting.
* **Project Management:**
* Proven experience in managing large-scale compliance projects from initiation to completion.
* Certification in project management (e.g., PMP) is a plus.
* **Legal Knowledge:**
* Basic understanding of international trade law and its implications on import/export activities.
* Experience working with legal teams to resolve compliance issues.
* **Communication Skills:**
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills to effectively interact with internal teams, vendors, and regulatory authorities.
* Experience in drafting compliance reports and presenting findings to senior management.
* **Technical Proficiency:**
* Advanced proficiency in customs compliance software and tools.
* Experience with ERP systems other than Blue Cherry is a plus.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $80,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Retail Merchandising Supervisor
description:

* Associate discounts on in-store and online merchandise, services and warranty plans

title: Psychotherapist/Intensive In-Community Counselor (IIC)
description:
**About our Company**

The name “Silver Lining” is rooted in crisis theory and the idea that though crisis is unpleasant, difficult and traumatic, the result is always change. That change can be positive with help, support and guidance. That is exactly what our clinicians do: assist children and their families to navigate through their crisis, achieve stability, and find or create positive outcomes from whatever storm has come their way. Issues we assist families with include (but are not limited to) mental health, behavioral problems, family conflict, and parenting difficulties.

Silver Lining was founded by Chrissy Webber, a licensed clinical social worker (LCSW) and trauma specialist who has served the children and families of Sussex and Morris counties since 2008 in various capacities, including non-profit child protection work, outpatient mental health, private practice, and school social work.

At Silver Lining we have high standards of excellence for our staff, and we care just as deeply about staff wellbeing as we do the clients we serve. Chrissy, our founder, provides training and clinical supervision herself (free of charge) for those who are working toward their LCSW or LPC, and is always on call should clinicians need assistance in between formal supervision sessions or while in the field. Chrissy is an experienced certified clinical supervisor for both disciplines, and has assisted many clinicians to achieve their independent licensure. We support our clinicians’ professional development by providing access to CEU training opportunities offered through NJ Children’s System of Care (CSOC) at no charge.

We invite each of our clinicians to choose how many clients they would like to take on, the geographic location in which they would like to work, the ages of children/youth with whom they feel comfortable working, and the types of presenting problems which are within the scope of their training & expertise. This could be a full- or part-time position; the choice is yours! Please note, it is necessary for applicants to be willing to meet with clients in person in order to facilitate a consistent caseload.

A position with our practice is ideal for those who are looking for a home-based, flexible schedule. Working parents, people looking to supplement a full time position elsewhere (whether the need is financial or for extra clinical hours), clinicians new to the field, and others have all found their work at Silver Lining meaningful, fulfilling, helpful to their professional growth, and productive in working toward their professional goals.

Intensive In-Community counselors provide 1-2 hour sessions each week to each client, whether they choose to travel to the child/youth’s home or elsewhere in the community, or hold sessions via telehealth.

**Intensive In-Community Counselor Job responsibilities:**

* Provide short-term individual or family therapy to children/youth age 2-21 and their families
* Complete assessments and treatment plans for each client
* Maintain progress notes and other HIPAA compliant documentation required by the NJCSOC
* Collaborate with children/youth case managers, DCP&P workers, and other professionals who may be involved with the child/youth

**Hourly Pay Rates:**

LCSW/LPC: $91/hour

LSW: $64/hour (clinical supervision included at no cost)

If you are interested in joining our supportive, professional team of clinicians, **please include cover letter and resume.**

*Applicants must possess: a valid NJ practice license, a valid driver’s license and reliable vehicle, the ability to pass a criminal background check, excellent documentation, time management, and communication skills.*

Work Location:

* Multiple locations within Sussex County and Morris Counties, NJ

Work Remotely

* rarely

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $64.00 - $91.00 per hour

Expected hours: 4 – 20 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Professional development assistance

Education:

* Master's (Required)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)
* LCSW (Preferred)
* LSW (Preferred)
* LPC (Preferred)
* LAC (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

* Newton, NJ: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Manager, B2B Web Designer
description:
\\*\\*Job Description:\\*\\* \\*\\*About Our Organization:\\*\\*



Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world’s largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America’s largest newspaper by paid circulation. Dow Jones works with many Global Fortune 500 companies providing the data, news and intelligence to help them reduce risk, ensure compliance and identify business opportunities. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).



About the Team:



As part of the global Marketing organization, the B2B Enterprise Marketing team is responsible for driving business growth in partnership with the product and sales teams of our enterprise businesses: Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, and Risk & Compliance. The team runs a client centric approach focused on industries and accounts developing and activating strategies and campaigns that drive awareness, build our reputation and deepen relationships in these select industries and accounts.



\\*\\*About the Role:\\*\\*



In this role, you will be responsible for designing and maintaining the visual system of our enterprise web experience (dowjones.com/professional/) in collaboration with the B2B Enterprise Marketing team. You will focus on designing a robust, responsive, user-friendly website experience that aligns with our overarching business goals.



This role is based in-person in New York, NY, working on-site in our midtown Manhattan office three days a week, reporting to the Director of Web Experience.



\\*\\*You Will:\\*\\*



+ Stay ahead of the curve by continuously exploring the latest web design trends and evaluating Dow Jones’ competitive landscape, ensuring our digital presence remains innovative, compelling and engaging.



+ Embrace a data-driven approach to design by monitoring and analyzing performance metrics, gaining insights into user engagement and optimizing designs based on real-world feedback.



+ Collaborate with the B2B Enterprise Marketing team to understand objectives and develop a best-in-class, user-friendly design system.



+ Work closely with social media and paid media team members to craft a cohesive and integrated design experience that enhances Dow Jones’ reach and impact. Partnering with art directors, designers, copywriters and external partners to achieve this synergy.



+ Design graphics, digital proofs, UI/UX layouts, and visual concepts that captivate and engage users.



+ Develop a deep understanding of our brand voice, visual identity to ensure a consistent and unified approach across all deliverables.



+ Craft style guides and work closely with other designers to execute design briefs.



+ Assist the marketing team in producing visual assets such as landing pages, web components and UI elements.



+ Develop wireframes and mock-ups that are both persuasive and visually appealing.



+ Create responsive templates optimized for desktop, mobile and tablet.



+ Research and develop user journeys to ensure seamless transitions between key sections of the site.



+ Provide development-ready designs to support ongoing site enhancements.



Specifically, you should have:



+ A minimum of 7 years of experience as a junior web designer or graphic designer.



+ A Bachelor’s degree in graphic design, web design, or a related field.



+ A strong portfolio showcasing expertise in previous web design projects.



+ Practical experience with design tools such as Figma, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator or Sketch.



+ An understanding of color theory, typography, layout design and usability principles, particularly for web design.



+ Proficiency in graphic design and a deep understanding of how various elements interact on a web page.



+ A creative mindset with exceptional visual communication skills, multimedia and design capabilities.



+ Excellent project management skills, with the ability to multitask, prioritize, manage stakeholders, and meet tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment.



+ A thorough understanding of the latest industry trends, design tools, and accessibility standards.



+ Working knowledge of HTML is a plus.



\\*\\*Our Benefits\\*\\*



+ Comprehensive Healthcare Plans



+ Paid Time Off



+ Retirement Plans



+ Comprehensive Insurance Plans



+ Lifestyle programs & Wellness Resources



+ Education Benefits



+ Family Care Benefits & Caregiving Support



+ Commuter Transit Program



+ Subscription Discounts



+ Employee Referral Program



Learn more about all our US benefits

We recognize that attracting the best talent is key to our strategy and success as a company.As a result, we aim for flexibility in structuring competitive compensation offers to ensure we are able to attract the best candidates.The quoted salary range represents our good faith estimate as to what our ideal candidates are likely to expect, and we tailor our offers within the range based on the selected candidate’s experience, industry knowledge, location, technical and communication skills, and other factors that may prove relevant during the interview process.

For benefits eligible roles, in addition to cash compensation, the company provides a comprehensive and highly competitive benefits package, with a variety of physical health, retirement and savings, caregiving, emotional wellbeing, transportation, and other benefits, including “elective” benefits employees may select to best fit the needs and personal situations of our diverse workforce..



Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the world’s top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barron’s, MarketWatch and Financial News.



This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands, Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence, with innovative technology, advanced data feeds, integrated solutions, expert research, award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers, when and where they need it, every day.

title: Experience Design Lead
description:
\\*\\*Job Description:\\*\\*



The Wall Street Journal and Dow Jones are seeking a talented and innovative Experience Design Lead for the Brand Marketing team. This role focuses on enhancing user experience (UX), customer journeys, and ensuring brand integrity across all marketing activities.



The Experience Design Lead will maximize the talents of their team, acting as a leader-doer. This hands-on role will oversee design projects across B2B and Wealth and Investing, ensuring brand consistency and high-caliber work. Reporting directly to the Brand Creative Director, the Experience Design Lead will play a crucial role in shaping the way our customers interact with our brands.



As the Experience Design Lead, you will leverage your expertise to optimize the customer experience across various marketing touchpoints, ensuring that all interactions are seamless, intuitive, well-designed, and aligned with our brand values. Your role will involve collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality, audience-centric design solutions that drive engagement, loyalty, and conversion.



Responsibilities & Activities



+ Lead the design and user experience across digital and brand touchpoints.



+ Innovate ideas to build strong, design-forward UX foundations, and improve design and user experience for existing websites and platforms.



+ Refine and improve customer journeys with a strategic, content-focused, design-forward, audience-first approach.



+ Ensure brand consistency, design and typographic excellence across all marketing efforts and customer journeys.



+ Connect the dots between creative briefs, teams, strategy, content, and creative assets.



+ Collaborate with multiple stakeholders to define UX objectives, and align design projects with business goals and objectives.



+ Understand and define project architecture from vision to execution, build project roadmaps to build coalition and guide progress.



+ Design and oversee new projects, including content strategy, wireframes, visual design, prototypes.



+ Guide and liaise with dev team and dev partners to establish parameters, limitations, timelines, requirements.



+ Review and provide design direction for the creative team’s work to ensure quality standards and adherence to project and business objectives.



+ Manage designers and other creative resources to deliver projects on tight deadlines.



+ Educate stakeholders and colleagues to build understanding of UX best practices.



+ Share knowledge and inspire the team with knowledge of design and UX trends, and deep interest in the creative landscape.



Qualifications & Criteria



+ 10+ years of experience in UX and UI design, or a similar in a senior or lead role.



+ Portfolio demonstrating proven design ability, strategic thinking, refined sensibility for UI, color and typography, with a focus on user experience and customer journeys.



+ Deep understanding of UX principles, content strategy and information hierarchy.



+ Experience designing and evolving visual identity and design systems.



+ Keen creative sensibility and dedication to design and typographic excellence.



+ Proven experience leading creative teams on complex projects from concept through execution.



+ Ability to work in a fast-paced, matrixed environment, across multiple projects.



+ Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to effectively present to and influence stakeholders.



+ Strong project management and organization skills.



+ Expertise with design and prototyping tools, such as Sketch, Figma, Adobe XD, InVision, and Adobe Creative Suite.



+ Ideally, a BA or BS degree in Design, UX Design, HCI, or a related field.

title: Research Editor, Special Lists
description:
\\*\\*Job Description:\\*\\*



About the Role



Dow Jones Risk & Compliance is a global provider of third-party risk management and regulatory compliance solutions. We deliver data, research tools and services to help our clients meet anti-money laundering, anti-bribery, anti-corruption and economic sanctions regulations and mitigate third-party risk.



You will join a team of multilingual experts who research, record and update details on individuals and entities mentioned in Sanctions & Other Official Lists (Special Lists) issued by government bodies and regulators around the world, for example, the Office of Foreign Assets Control in the US, national law enforcement bodies or securities regulators. You will report to the Manager, Sanctions & Other Official Lists. You will be based in Princeton.



You Will:



+ Create and update profiles of individuals and entities mentioned in Sanctions & Other Official Lists (Special Lists) and quality check their information by continually monitoring and analyzing relevant publicly available sources as well as data on Dow Jones owned products and specific directories



+ Research and extract relevant data adhering to team guidelines



+ Ensure that profiles are complete, accurate and up-to-date



+ Respond in writing to clients’ questions about Special Lists content



+ Monitor changes in sanctions, counter-terrorism financing and anti-money laundering regulations



+ Write due diligence reports on companies and/or individuals as required and contribute to other projects



+ Support R&C with translation services as and when required



+ Contribute to workflow improvements and tool efficiencies



You Have:



+ Fluency in English and at least one of the following languages: French, Russian, German



+ Excellent research, analytical and writing skills



+ Proofreading skills and experience handling large volumes of information



+ Sound decision-making and problem-solving skills



+ A reliable and responsible attitude



+ An openness to different views and appreciation of team diversity



+ The ability to manage priorities to meet deadlines



+ The ability to communicate effectively



Preferred:



+ Knowledge of the workings of the global Sanctions landscape



+ Automation skills, such as advanced knowledge of Excel, Macros/VBA programming, Python, HTML and/or SQL



\\*\\*Our Benefits\\*\\*



+ Comprehensive Healthcare Plans



+ Paid Time Off



+ Retirement Plans



+ Comprehensive Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance Plans



+ Education Benefits



+ Paid Maternity and Paternity Leave



+ Family Care Benefits



+ Commuter Transit Program



+ Subscription Discounts



+ Employee Referral Program

Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barron’s, MarketWatch and Financial News.



This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. title: Real Estate Agent
description:

Are you passionate about real estate and eager to make a real impact? We're on the lookout for an enthusiastic and driven Real Estate Agent to become an integral part of our vibrant team. title: Product Designer II - Consumer Shopping
description:
**About the Role**
  

  

We're hiring a Product Designer for the Consumer Shopping Design team on Uber Eats. The design candidate has the opportunity to innovate from basket building through checkout for food, grocery, and retail on the Uber Eats app. Also, the design candidate will collaborate with the Uber Marketplace team to help make customer ordering faster and more affordable, and efficient.
  

  

As Product Designers, we tackle challenges and work on big new ideas that will transform how people use our products. In a rapidly growing environment, we collaborate with engineers, product managers, content designers and some of the world's best designers and researchers. We make magic by crafting and shipping delightful experiences for people around the globe.
  

  

Every designer on the team has the opportunity to create solutions across all of Uber's consumer platforms, serving an incredibly diverse user base that spans the globe. As a member of our design team you'll work with stakeholders across many functions, levels and geographies.
  

  

**What You Will Do*** Collaborate with the cross-functional team to create high-quality design solutions for the product.
* Build wireframes, prototypes, and visual designs based on our UI framework to take on complex UX problems
* Partner with product managers and engineers on product strategy, planning and feature launches
* Use research methodologies to turn customer feedback into actionable findings
* Develop and maintain detailed design patterns that scale
* Understand and respond to data (metric tests, usability studies) and utilize data to inform future design
* Present work in a range of mediums and fidelities throughout the design process. Give and solicit feedback from other designers to continually raise our bar for quality.
* Draw from existing brand guidelines and standards to maintain consistency across design language and patterns

**Basic Qualifications*** 3+ years experience in designing consumer products

**Preferred Qualifications*** Proficiency with the latest tools to build design and a strong desire to learn new ones. Figma expertise is required.
* Effective prototyping skills.
* Experience building products for Android, iOS, and the web.
* Fast-paced with the ability to prioritize projects concurrently.
* Strong understanding and application of user-centered design methods and principles.
* Experience working and collaborating with teams with varied strengths in a multifaceted, rapid-growth environment.
* Ability to strongly articulate your design work and rationale to your peers and cross-functional team.
* A degree in HCI, Graphic Design or a related field is preferred.
A portfolio showing your high quality, thoughtful UI and UX work.  
* 

  

  

For New York, NY-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$146,000 per year - USD$162,000 per year. For San Francisco, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$146,000 per year - USD$162,000 per year. For all US locations, you will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award & other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits.

title: Animal Care And Adoptions Specialist - NYC
description:
**Animal Care and Adoptions Specialist - NYC**

New York, New York / Hourly / Full time



**The Best Friend's Mission is to do nothing short of making history by bringing about a time when there are No More Homeless Pets. Our goal is that every animal shelter in every community in the country be no kill by the end of 2025.**

The fact is, we have a great culture, populated by fun, dedicated and brilliant people. But we're always looking for talented people who can help us make history, and that's where you come in. **If you want to be a part of history and end the killing of shelter pets by 2025, apply today for one of our open job opportunities!**


**Location:** NY Adoption Center (Soho)

**Hiring Range:** This position’s hiring range is anticipated to be $21 per hour to $23 per hour, depending on experience, plus great benefits.

**Interviews will occur weekly until the position is filled.**

**Position Summary:** Animal Care and Adoptions Specialists are responsible for the daily functions, and growth of lifesaving programs such as adoptions, as well as providing basic animal care for animals in our program locations. Specialists act with urgency to accomplish important tasks and play a direct role in achieving Best Friends Animal Society’s no-kill mission and organizational success. Specialists may receive intensive assignments in a particular program, based on organizational needs.

**Essential Duties Responsibilities:**

* Demonstrate kindness and the Golden Rule in our everyday actions by practicing inclusion and respect for every person for the value they bring to the table. Be a role model for the spirit of authenticity, kindness and positive influence with each other, our visitors, and volunteers as well as to the animals every day. This includes listening, being present, being supportive of others and demonstrating compassion and curiosity in conflict.
* Responsible for the daily functions, and growth of lifesaving programs such as adoptions, as well as providing basic animal care for animals in our program locations.
* Promote and facilitate pet adoptions, providing superior customer service, new pet parent counselling, and post-adoption support throughout.
* Deliver superior customer service, assist adopters, fosters and transfer partners by gathering information to match them with appropriate animals; develop general knowledge of the animals in the Best Friends’ care, and in our partner shelters’ care, when necessary, to best match both animal and client needs.
* Work directly with and support volunteers on all aspects and protocols of lifesaving care and outcome programs, including but not limited to program protocols, cleaning protocols, specific animal behavior and care, animal handling, transportation requirements and procedures, data entry, and communications.
* Work collaboratively with Best Friends’ team members in all areas of operations to achieve lifesaving goals; follow Best Friends policies, procedures, and task lists for daily lifesaving outcome assignments, including accurate and timely communications, work completion, data entry, and recordkeeping.
* Maintain a safe workplace, value, and model safe work practices, adhering to organizational safety practices and rules, and communicate to leadership about unsafe practices and conditions.

**Skills and Experience:**

* A minimum of 1 year working professionally with dogs and cats is strongly preferred. Ability to work with, leash, kennel, walk, and handle cats and dogs, including those with health and/or behavior conditions/concerns; basic ability to identify and speak to medical and behavioral characteristics of dogs and cats. Fear free certification is a plus.
* Bilingual or multi-lingual skills preferred but not required.
* Customer-centric, non-judgmental approach to engaging with adopters, partners, visitors, volunteers, and colleagues; familiarity and comfort with a conversational adoption process. Prior experience working with the public and providing high levels of customer is required.
* Strong interpersonal skills, a team player, personable, professional, and able to get along with people from different backgrounds, as well as the ability to handle sensitive and confidential situations.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with well-developed organization skills to juggle multiple competing tasks and demands.
* Resourceful, get-it-done attitude; initiative to assist in any area or process; problem solving, seeking answers independently and enthusiastically; flexibility to persist until goals are achieved.
* Proficiency with Microsoft Office products; familiarity with shelter software/animal management software, or desire to learn.

**Physical Requirements:**

* Routinely lift 40 pounds and perform daily strenuous activity including, but not limited to lifting, carrying, reaching, stooping, squatting, cleaning, and bending.
* Perform repetitive tasks for extended periods of time including typing, sitting, walking, arm, and hand motion.
* Work indoors and outdoors in a variety of weather conditions including extreme heat and cold.
* Exposure to dogs, cats and other animals of all sizes, temperaments, and medical status.
* Valid driver’s license, meeting Best Friends Animal Society’s driver qualification standards; ability to travel, including overnight stays, when needed.
* Daily hours and days of the week may vary according to the needs of the department schedule; position includes weekends, nights, and holiday work.

*Thank you for your interest in pursuing a career at Best Friends Animal Society. Best Friends Animal Society is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, ancestry, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, marital status, or domestic partner status.*

*Applicants for employment in the US must have valid work authorization that does not now and/or will not in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the US by Best Friends Animal Society.*


**Culture Statement and Responsibility**

We value attitude over aptitude, and we treat Kindness as a discipline because it is paramount in our culture along with our other Guiding Principles. Culture is how we talk to and treat ourselves and one another, it's how we generate and respond to change, it's how we plan and make decisions, it's how we do what we do.

title: Fitness Center General Manager
description:
**Job Overview:**



We are currently seeking a reliable and dedicated **General Manager** to work at a high-profile company’s fitness center located in **Midtown Manhattan, New York**.



In this role, you will manage and direct all operations, staffing, revenue and expense goals and marketing aspects of the site, as well as assume the key responsibility (and assist the Client Coordinator) in the marketing, promotion, planning and staffing of programs. You will act as a direct liaison between the Company and the Client. Although you will spend less time on the site floor, you will still maintain a high profile with your team and members.


**What you will do:**


* Provide leadership to set the tone and personality of the site by making it a motivating and engaging place to work.
* Implement product capabilities, programs and marketing for member engagement.
* Take responsibility for primary human capital responsibilities, such as hiring, coaching, motivating, scheduling, training, developing, evaluating, assigning projects and workload to and, when necessary, terminating team members.
* Respond to members’ feedback and concerns in a timely and professional manner while providing excellent customer service.
* Provide recurring reports to your direct leadership.
* Ensure that your team is providing gold-standard customer service and programming.
* Encourage professional development for your team and enhance retention.
* Implement and follow policies and procedures.
  


**What we are looking for:**


* A bachelor’s degree, with two to three years of management experience.
* Ability to multi-task, and to execute time management, problem-solving, organization and follow-up skills.
* Ability to hire, coach, train and develop team members.
* Knowledge of financial reporting, such as budgeting, forecasting and strategic business planning.
* Prior experience in a corporate fitness or spa setting.
* Current CPR/AED and First Aid certifications.
* Competence with Microsoft Suite (Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook) and finance and payroll systems.
  


**About Us:**



Plus One, part of the Optum Workplace Well-being portfolio of services, provides fitness and well-being services to clients across a broad range of industries, driving employee engagement in health and wellness programs. Our services include fitness, nutrition, ergonomics, wellness coaching and health promotion. Our team members believe that the most effective way to help people adopt a healthier lifestyle is through personal connections infused with hospitality, empathy and a lot of fun.


**Perks of working at Plus One, an Optum company\\*:**


**Health and financial:**


* Medical plan choices with Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) and Health Savings Account (HSA) options
* Dental and Vision coverage plans
* 401(k) Retirement & Savings Plan
* Life Insurance (team member, spouse and dependents)
* Short and Long Term Disability Plans
* Accident & Critical Illness Insurance
* Transportation and Parking Plans
* Paid parental leave
  


**Well-being:**


* Paid time off
* Wellness rewards program
* Free memberships to various fitness facilities and wellness subscriptions
* 24/7 health and wellness support through the Employee Assistance program
* Entertainment and consumer discounts
* Dedication to ensuring a cohesive and inclusive culture led by an internal diversity, equity and inclusion council
  


**Growth and development:**


* Free professional development courses through internal learning management systems
* Discounted certifications through industry leading agencies
* Free CPR/AED certifications
* Free continuing education courses and credits
* Employee Referral Reward program
  


* Please note, some of the benefits listed above are only available to team members who work full time hours.


**Equal opportunity statement**



Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere. Plus One, an Optum Company is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Pay is based on several factors including, but not limited to, education, work experience, certifications, geographic differentials, and other business and organizational needs. In addition to the hourly rate, Plus One offers a comprehensive benefits package (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements), which includes health insurance, life and disability benefits, 401(k) plan, and paid time off. title: Entry Level Sales Representative
description:
*Are you a persuasive communicator with a talent for building rapport? Do you have a passion for home improvement and a keen eye for design? SECI Construction Inc is looking for a dynamic Door-to-Door Appointment Setter to join our team!*

*In this role, you'll engage with homeowners in the local community, promote our top-notch roofing and exterior improvement services, and schedule appointments for our sales representatives. This position offers excellent growth opportunities, attractive incentives, and the chance to be part of a successful, well-established company. If you’re ready to make an impact and grow with us, we want to hear from you!*

**Responsibilities:**

* Conduct door-to-door visits in residential neighborhoods to introduce homeowners to SECI Construction Inc.'s products and services and set appointments for windows, siding, and roofing estimates.
* Engage directly with potential customers at their homes. No cold calling or selling required.
* Provide accurate information about our company's services, pricing, and warranties.
* Schedule appointments for interested homeowners to meet with our experienced sales representatives for in-home consultations.
* Maintain detailed records of interactions, leads generated, and appointment schedules.
* Collaborate with the sales team to ensure a seamless customer experience throughout the sales process.
* Stay updated on industry trends and product knowledge to address customer queries confidently.

**Requirements:**

* Previous experience in sales, customer service, or canvassing is preferred but not required. We value enthusiasm and a positive attitude.
* Excellent verbal communication skills, with the ability to convey information clearly and persuasively.
* Comfortable working outdoors and in various weather conditions.
* Basic computer skills to maintain records and schedule appointments.
* Knowledge of Roofing and Exterior Improvements is a plus but not mandatory; we provide comprehensive training.
* Applicants must have a valid driver's license, a car, smartphone and US citizenship.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive Based pay plus commission with generous commission structure.
* Performance-based bonuses and incentives.
* Comprehensive training and ongoing support to enhance your sales skills.
* Opportunity for career advancement within SECI Construction Inc
* Flexible working hours and a dynamic, friendly work environment.
* The satisfaction of offering high-quality products that enhance homeowners' lives.

*Join the SECI Construction Inc team and be part of a company that values its employees and customers alike. If you have the drive to succeed in sales and want to make a significant impact in the Roofing and Exterior Improvements. Apply now and let's discuss how you can become an integral part of our success story!*

title: Clinical Support Case Manager Early Career
description:
Turning Point is recruiting for a Clinical Support Case Manager for our detox unit program. The Case Manager shall provide case management support to clients served in the residential program and provide and assistance to primary counselors as needed.

**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:**

Case Management:

1. Facilitate contacts as needed and directed by Clinical Staff between clients and any directed entities

2. Support clinical staff in carrying out case management functions as directed by the Director of Clinical Services, Unit Manager or Primary Counselor.

3. Document all encounters in Electronic Health Record and Case Manager Log.

Clinical Clerical Functions:

1. Collect clients Welcome Assessment Packets and give to the primary counselor

2. Ensure that all Admission Satisfaction Surveys and Program Satisfaction Surveys are collected and filed as needed.

Clinical Support

1. Assist clinical staff when director by the Unit Manager or designee. This may include provision of assessment, treatment planning, individual counseling and group therapy.

2. Present didactic sessions on chemical dependency and other related issues.

3. Document individual and group counseling sessions using the D.A.P. format.

4. Coordinate client’s medical treatment with medical department or outside facility as indicated.

5. Perform all reporting and record keeping in accordance with Turning Point policy.

6. Participates in all clinical staff meetings.

7. Responsible for knowing and enforcing Turning Point Policy and Procedure.

8. Responsible for maintaining status of CADC and participating in continuing education courses. If not certified, responsible for attaining CADC within 3 years of hire into counseling position.

9. Performs all other duties as necessary or as assigned by supervisor.

**EDUCATION:** Bachelor’s degree, working toward substance abuse credential CADC or LCADC

**EXPERIENCE:** Some experience working with Substance Use Disordered clients, twelve step knowledge a plus.

**QUALIFICATIONS**: Strong record keeping, organizational skills and interpersonal skills. Excellent customer service skills necessary as well as the ability to work well within a team. I

title: Furnace Technician
description:
**Job Title:** **Furnace Technician**
=====================================

Location:
Garden City, NY, US, 11530
Business Unit: Treitler FMH
Posting Date: Sep 12, 2024
Job Description:
The Hughes-Treitler Business Unit designs and manufactures state of the art plate-fin heat exchangers, cold plates, condensers, evaporators, and other heat transfer products. We provide custom design and engineering services, to high quality manufacturing standards, for the aircraft, engine and industrial heat exchangers in the mobile/marine/avionics/space and missile markets.

  

AMETEK Hughes-Treitler is seeking a Furnace Technician to assist with processing and maintaining the machines utilized in the Vacuum Braze Department.

  

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

  


* Load and unload furnaces
* Perform all maintenance and repair on furnaces
* Perform all quarterly furnace uniformity surveys
* Assemble Statistical Process Control (SPC) data
* Set-up and braze cores and cold plates per routers and work instructions, PPSs, WPs and Braze parameters
* Additional tasks may be assigned as needed

  




**EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE:**

  


* High School Diploma or GED
* Must be able to read, write and, converse in English
* Must have the ability to read blueprints
* Must be mechanically inclined
* Must have the ability to work with hand tools

  




**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:**

  


* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear. This position is very active and requires standing, walking, bending, kneeling, stooping, crouching, crawling, and climbing all day. The employee must frequently lift and/or move items over 50 pounds.
* Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus. Fine manipulation and repetitive motion may be required for some duties.

  


**EQUIPMENT USED:**

  


Abar Ipsen Aluminum Brazer, Abar Ipsen/Sunbeam Aluminum Brazer and Veeco Helium Leak Detector

  


**OTHER:**

  


* Due to contracts with the United States Government, the candidate must be either a United States Citizen or Green Card holder
**Compensation**
----------------


Salary Minimum: $50,000
Salary Maximum: $70,000
Incentive: No
Disclaimer: Where a specific pay range is noted, it is a good faith estimate at the time of this posting. The actual salary offered will be based on experience, skills, qualifications, market / business considerations, and geographic location.


AMETEK, Inc. is a leading global provider of industrial technology solutions serving a diverse set of attractive niche markets with annual sales over $7.0 billion.


AMETEK is committed to making a safer, sustainable, and more productive world a reality. We use differentiated technology solutions to solve our customers’ most complex challenges. We employ 21,000 colleagues, in 35 countries, that are grounded by our core values: Ethics and Integrity, Respect for the Individual, Inclusion, Teamwork, and Social Responsibility. AMETEK (NYSE:AME) is a component of the S&P 500. Visit www.ametek.com for more information.


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. Individuals who need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process should call 1 (866) 263-8359.
